meanings.definition: The quality of being childishly sulky or bad-tempered.
meanings.sent1: Her constant petulances made it hard to enjoy spending time with her.
meanings.sent2: His petulances often resulted in unnecessary arguments with his siblings.
meanings.sent3: During the game, his petulances over losing were quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky mirrored the petulances of the upset child.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience was tested by the student's petulances in class.

meanings.sent1: After his petulances at the party, he was left alone in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The petulances she displayed during the meeting were unprofessional.
meanings.sent3: His petulances over not getting the dessert he wanted were quite funny.
meanings.sent4: The petulances of the spoiled child were like a storm in a teacup.
meanings.sent5: The petulances of the toddler were met with a patient smile from his mother.
